Framework-Specific Smell Detector

class ml_code_smell_detector.detectors.framework_detector.FrameworkSpecificSmellDetector[source]

Bases: object

A detector for identifying code smells specific to ML frameworks like Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, PyTorch and TensorFlow.

This class analyzes Python code to detect common anti-patterns and suboptimal implementations when using popular machine learning frameworks. It provides suggestions for improvements and best practices.

detect_smells(file_path)[source]

Analyze a Python file for framework-specific code smells.

Parameters:

file_path (str) – Path to the Python file to analyze

Returns:

  • framework: The ML framework the smell relates to

  • name: Name of the code smell

  • how_to_fix: Instructions for fixing the issue

  • benefits: Benefits of fixing the issue

  • line_number: Line where the smell was detected

  • code_snippet: The problematic code

  • file_path: Path to the file containing the smell

Return type:

List of dictionaries containing detected code smells with details like

get_frameworks_used(node)[source]

Detect which ML frameworks are imported in the code.

Parameters:

node (Module) – AST node representing the Python module

Returns:

List of framework names found in imports (e.g. [‘Pandas’, ‘NumPy’])

Return type:

List[str]

visit_module(node, file_path, frameworks_used)[source]

Visit a Python module to detect framework-specific smells.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the Python module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

  • frameworks_used (List[str]) – List of frameworks detected in the code

add_smell(framework, smell_name, node, file_path)[source]

Add a detected code smell to the results.

Parameters:

  • framework (str) – Name of the framework (e.g. ‘Pandas’, ‘NumPy’)

  • smell_name (str) – Name of the detected smell

  • node (NodeNG) – AST node where the smell was found

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file containing the smell

detect_pandas_smells(node, file_path)[source]

Detect Pandas-specific code smells like: - Unnecessary iteration instead of vectorization - Chain indexing - Missing merge parameters - Inplace operations - Inefficient values usage - Missing dtype specifications - Suboptimal column selection - DataFrame modifications in loops

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the Python module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

detect_sklearn_smells(node, file_path)[source]

Detect Scikit-learn specific code smells like: - Missing data scaling - Not using pipelines - Missing cross validation - Missing random state - Missing verbose mode - Using only threshold-dependent metrics - Missing unit tests - Data leakage risks - Missing exception handling

Parameters:

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

detect_pytorch_smells(node, file_path)[source]

Detect PyTorch-specific code smells like: - Missing random seeds - Not using deterministic mode - DataLoader randomness issues - Missing masks for numerical operations - Direct forward() calls - Missing gradient zeroing - Missing batch normalization - Missing dropout - Missing data augmentation - Missing learning rate scheduling - Missing logging - Missing model evaluation mode

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the Python module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

detect_tensorflow_smells(node, file_path)[source]

Detect TensorFlow-specific code smells like: - Missing random seeds - Missing early stopping - Missing checkpointing - Memory leaks - Missing masks - Python lists instead of TensorArrays - Missing threshold-independent metrics - Missing logging - Missing batch normalization - Missing dropout - Missing data augmentation - Missing learning rate scheduling - Missing model evaluation

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the Python module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

generate_report()[source]

Generate a detailed text report of all detected code smells.

Returns:

  • Framework-specific smell counts

  • Details for each smell including location and fixes

  • Total number of smells detected

Return type:

A formatted string containing the analysis report with

get_results()[source]

Get a simplified list of detected code smells.

Returns:

  • framework: The ML framework

  • name: Name of the smell

  • fix: How to fix it

  • benefits: Benefits of fixing

  • location: Where it was found

Return type:

List of dictionaries containing

get_smells()[source]
Return type:

Dict[str, List[Dict[str, str]]]
